Award.AwardTitle: Model Theory of Valued Fields and Applications
Award.AbstractNarration:
This NSF award will provide funding to support travel of researchers based in the US to attend the conference "Model Theory of Valued Fields and Applications", to be held on June 10-14, 2019 at the Institute for Mathematical Logic and Foundational Research, Munster, Germany.

The aim of this conference is to bring together specialists from the algebraic (or arithmetic) and the pure model theory community who all study valued fields, but with very different tools. The talks will range from the more classical model theory of valued fields to the pure and geometric side of the model theory spectrum. There will also be talks presenting applications of model theory of valued fields, e.g. to non-archimedean geometry and motivic integration. This award provides an opportunity for US based early stage researchers and Ph.D students to learn from the world-leading experts and to actively engage in research on these recent developments.
More details are available at the conference website https://ivv5hpp.uni-muenster.de/u/fjahn_01/mtvfa/

This award reflects NSF's statutory mission and has been deemed worthy of support through evaluation using the Foundation's intellectual merit and broader impacts review criteria.

POR.DRECONTENT:
The project provided funding to support US-based participants, particularly graduate students and recent Ph.Ds, to attend the conference Model Theory of Valued Fields and Applications (https://ivv5hpp.uni-muenster.de/u/fjahn_01/mtvfa/) that took place at the University of Muenster, Munster, Germany on 10-14 June 2019.
The aim of the conference was to bring together experts, early stage researchers and graduate students from the algebraic and the pure model theory community who all study valued fields, but with very different tools. The topics covered in the talks were of interdisciplinary character (model theory, field arithmetic, non-archimedean geometry and motivic integration). This meeting was the main model theory conference of the summer 2019, and the grant helped the US based researchers to get actively involved in these current developments, leading to further research and collaboration.
In particular, the award allowed several US based early stage researchers and Ph.D students to actively engage in one-on-one and small group research on cutting-edge topics in model-theory and algebra with the leading experts in the area. The meeting led to continuation of existing and creation of new collaborations, and progress on the research topics of the meeting was reported by several of the supported participants, that already led or is expected to lead to preprints and scientific publications. A dedicated poster session held during the meeting provided an opportunity for younger participants to gain scientific presentation experience and receive feedback from the experts.


Last Modified: 07/05/2020
Modified by: Artem Chernikov
